title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: I’m about to inherit a lot of money. How do I make sure my husband doesn’t get any of it?
items.description: “We want to invest the money and play catch up with our retirement savings/funding.”

items.title: After my father died, my stepsister transferred assets into her name. Do I have any legal recourse?
items.description: “Since my dad died, I’ve been able to get just one box of personal mementos and some family possessions.”

items.title: ‘Her kids will have no inheritance’: Will my friend lose her house to Medicaid if she goes into a nursing home?
items.description: “She would like to leave her kids something after she dies.”

items.title: How the Trump administration could lower mortgage rates and bypass the Treasury market entirely
items.description: The White House could have a path to lowering mortgage rates even without longer-dated Treasury yields falling, a strategist says.

items.title: $5,000 gold and other trades that Goldman, JPMorgan say may be coming if the market loses faith in the Fed
items.description: Investors should diversify into commodities as inflation concerns build

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

items.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
items.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
